intro: Oxyceros rectispinus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oxyceros, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have four petals. Oxyceros rectispinus is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
